title: Fix XSS: replace innerHTML with textContent for nav
description: Agent names from localStorage are injected via innerHTML in nav bar across ~6 page templates (~lines 587, 2610, 3462, 3822, 4205, 4244 in src/main.py). Tamperable localStorage = DOM-based XSS. Fix: replace innerHTML with DOM construction using createElement + textContent. Also add escHtml() JS utility for the leaderboard dynamic table (tbody.innerHTML at ~line 2553) and the WS toast at ~line 3120.

title: Serve /skill.md and fix robots.txt
description: Two broken-link / hygiene fixes: (1) /skill.md returns 404 on production even though the file exists in the repo and is copied into the Docker image. Add a route to serve it as text/markdown. (2) robots.txt exists but is comments-only with no User-agent/Disallow directives and sitemap.xml is 404. Add minimal robots.txt directives and optionally a basic sitemap.

title: Fix XSS: escape user values in server-rendered HTML
description: Add html.escape() wrapper (esc() helper) for all user-controlled values in f-string HTML templates in src/main.py. Agent names, post titles, content, avatar URLs, comment content, and description fields are interpolated into HTML without entity-encoding. bleach.clean() strips tags but doesn't encode for attribute contexts (alt, title, onclick, src). Fix: import html, add esc() helper, wrap ~30 interpolation sites. Special case: line ~3916 onclick with comment.agent.name needs data-* attributes instead of inline JS string.

title: Security: prevent agent enumeration via sequential IDs
description: Agent IDs are sequential integers (1, 2, 3...). /api/v1/agents/{id} is public — trivial to enumerate every agent profile. Options: use UUIDs or slug-based lookups instead of sequential ints, or accept this as intentionally public data and document it. Lower priority since agent profiles are public by design.

title: Add /.well-known/security.txt
description: Both /.well-known/security.txt and /security.txt return 404. Add a security.txt with a contact email and optional disclosure policy. Low effort, good hygiene for receiving responsible disclosure reports.

title: CSB hardening: Railway/Postgres, migrations, security, correctness
description:
Objective: make ClawStreetBots production-grade for Railway+Postgres.

Scope:
- Reliability/ops: require DATABASE_URL in prod, add /healthz + /readyz, fix Railway healthcheck, structured logging.
- DB correctness: introduce proper migrations (Alembic), enforce constraints (votes, follows), backfills.
- Security: hash API keys, add rotation/revocation, rate limiting.
- Correctness: idempotent vote endpoints, comment threading validation.
- Quality: CI, tests, linting, module split.

Deliverables: PRs that keep deploy green + tests; no more schema drift causing 500s.
notes: Started hardening. Closed: clawstreetbots-co2, clawstreetbots-9w4.1, clawstreetbots-9w4.2, clawstreetbots-9w4.4 (commit ee0e7b9). Next up: Alembic (9w4.3) then API key hashing/rotation (9w4.6).

title: Reliability: require DATABASE_URL (Railway/Postgres) + remove prod sqlite fallback
description: Railway deploy must use Postgres. If RAILWAY_ENVIRONMENT set and DATABASE_URL missing, fail fast on startup with clear log + exit non-zero. Keep local sqlite fallback only for dev.
notes: Implemented + pushed in ee0e7b9: prod disables /docs|/redoc|/openapi, Railway requires DATABASE_URL, added /healthz + /readyz and set Railway healthcheckPath=/healthz, added .dockerignore.

title: Ops: add /healthz + /readyz; change Railway healthcheckPath to /healthz
description: Implement lightweight /healthz (no DB) and /readyz (DB connectivity + migrations applied). Update railway.json to point healthcheckPath to /healthz. Ensure current /api/v1/stats stays functional for monitoring but is not the deploy gate.
notes: Implemented + pushed in ee0e7b9: prod disables /docs|/redoc|/openapi, Railway requires DATABASE_URL, added /healthz + /readyz and set Railway healthcheckPath=/healthz, added .dockerignore.

title: DB: introduce Alembic migrations (no more create_all-only)
description: Add Alembic, generate baseline, migrate existing schema safely, and wire deploy/start to run migrations (with locking). Ensure migrations cover new columns/constraints going forward.

title: Repo hygiene: remove tracked sqlite DB; add .dockerignore; ensure secrets not tracked
description: If clawstreetbots.db is tracked, remove it from git (git rm --cached). Add .dockerignore to keep db/venv out of Docker context. Audit repo for leaked artifacts.
notes: Implemented + pushed in ee0e7b9: prod disables /docs|/redoc|/openapi, Railway requires DATABASE_URL, added /healthz + /readyz and set Railway healthcheckPath=/healthz, added .dockerignore.

title: Correctness: enforce vote constraints + idempotency (post & comment votes)
description: DB constraints: exactly one of vote.post_id/vote.comment_id set; unique per (agent_id, post_id) and (agent_id, comment_id). API: idempotent upvote/downvote/toggle behavior; counters never go negative.

title: Security: hash API keys + add rotate/revoke + rate limit
description: Store only hashed API keys. Return raw key only at creation. Add rotate/revoke endpoints. Add basic per-key + per-IP rate limiting (slowapi or equivalent) and structured auth failure logs.

title: Quality: CI + smoke tests + split main.py into routers
description: Add GitHub Actions: lint + typecheck + tests. Add minimal smoke tests (register -> post -> vote -> comment). Refactor code into routers/schemas/db modules for maintainability.

title: Tighten CORS + fix readyz info leak
description: Two quick fixes in src/main.py: (1) CORS lines 141-147: change allow_methods from * to GET,POST,PATCH,DELETE,OPTIONS and allow_headers from * to Authorization,Content-Type,Accept. (2) Readyz line 165: change detail from f-string with exception to static 'Not ready' -- current version leaks DB connection strings in HTTP response. Log error server-side instead.

title: Security: validate avatar_url and ticker inputs
description: avatar_url accepts any string up to 500 chars — potential SSRF vector if rendered server-side, or phishing links in client. tickers field is free-text with no format validation. Fix: allowlist domains for avatar URLs (e.g. dicebear, gravatar, github), validate ticker format (1-5 uppercase alpha, comma-separated).

title: Add Cache-Control: no-store on registration response
description: The POST /api/v1/agents/register response contains the API key shown once. This response should include Cache-Control: no-store and Pragma: no-cache to prevent browser or proxy caching of the key. Also verify the key never appears in URLs (query params/fragments) where it could leak via logs and referrers.

title: Security: move web auth from localStorage to HTTP-only cookies
description: Web UI stores csb_api_key in localStorage. Any XSS vulnerability instantly leaks the API key. No HTTP-only cookies or server-side sessions exist. Fix: use HTTP-only secure cookies for web browser sessions, keep Bearer token auth for API-only bot clients. This also means adding CSRF protection.

title: Security: disable /docs and /openapi.json in production
description: FastAPI auto-generates Swagger UI at /docs and schema at /openapi.json. Both are publicly accessible and expose full API surface (37 endpoints), all request/response schemas including RegisterResponse which documents api_key and claim_code fields. Disable in production or gate behind auth. Quick fix: set docs_url=None, redoc_url=None, openapi_url=None in FastAPI() constructor when RAILWAY_ENVIRONMENT is set.
notes: Implemented + pushed in ee0e7b9: prod disables /docs|/redoc|/openapi, Railway requires DATABASE_URL, added /healthz + /readyz and set Railway healthcheckPath=/healthz, added .dockerignore.

title: Security: add authentication to WebSocket endpoint
description: /ws endpoint accepts unauthenticated connections. Anyone can subscribe to real-time feed of all posts, votes, and comments. Require auth token on WebSocket upgrade (pass api_key as query param or first message).

title: Fix 500s on /agent/{id} for missing agents
description: Agent profile pages like /agent/69 and /agent/54 return 500 Internal Server Error instead of a clean 404. Validate agent IDs, handle missing records with a user-friendly 404 page. Confirm production error responses never include stack traces. This is visible to anyone browsing the site.

title: Add security response headers middleware
description: Zero security headers set. Add BaseHTTPMiddleware after CORS middleware (~line 147) in src/main.py. Headers: X-Content-Type-Options nosniff, X-Frame-Options DENY, Referrer-Policy strict-origin-when-cross-origin, Permissions-Policy camera=() microphone=() geolocation=(), CSP (default-src self, script-src self unsafe-inline cdn.tailwindcss.com, style-src self unsafe-inline, img-src self api.dicebear.com data:, connect-src self wss: ws:, frame-ancestors none, object-src none, base-uri self), HSTS in prod only. Note: unsafe-inline required because all JS is inline f-strings.

title: Launch Readiness: Throwing to the Wolves
description: The practical checklist to make ClawStreetBots ready for public launch (Reddit/PH/X).

title: UX: Homepage overhaul (Hook + CTA + Bullet points)
description: Implement above-the-fold hook, CTA, and 3-bullet value prop as per launch checklist.

title: Safety: Basic Moderation Tools
description: Implement Admin delete/ban and User 'Report' buttons.

title: UX: Social Shareability (OG images + Share buttons)
description: Add OG images, metadata, and 'Share to X' buttons to post/agent/ticker pages.

title: UX: Onboarding (Public read access)
description: Ensure all pages are readable without login; only require auth for posting/commenting.

title: Content: Automated Agent Poster System
description: Build a scheduled system to post agent content automatically via API/Cron.

title: Content: Personality Definitions & Style Contracts
description: Define 5-10 characters with consistent voices and style contracts.

title: Content: Scheduled Loops (Recaps/Tape)
description: Implement morning tape, EOD recap, and trade-of-the-day automated formats.

title: Stats: Agent Scoreboards (Win-rate + Returns)
description: Display basic win-rate, returns, and last 10 trades on agent profiles.

title: Stats: Signal Storage (Structured Data Logging)
description: Store structured signal data (ticker, entry, exit, etc.) behind every trade post.

title: Trust: Analytics integration (PostHog)
description: Integrate PostHog for tracking activation, post creation, and retention.

title: Pre-Share Security Pass
description: Security hardening required before sharing the site publicly. Covers XSS fixes (server-side and DOM-based), security response headers, CORS tightening, and readyz info leak. These are the minimum fixes to make the app safe for public eyes. Blocks launch readiness (clawstreetbots-lyl).

title: Security: add global rate limit + rate-limit all read endpoints
description: Only 4 of 37 endpoints have rate limits (register, create post, upvote, comment). All read endpoints (agents, posts, leaderboard, stats, activity, tickers) are unlimited — trivial to scrape entire platform. Also downvote has no rate limit while upvote does. Fix: add global rate limit (e.g. 300/min per IP) and per-endpoint limits on reads. Note: partially overlaps with clawstreetbots-9w4.6 which mentions rate limiting.
